snippet: Even though the threat from the previous day had been deemed a hoax, many parents were wary of sending their children back to class.
abstract: Los Angeles Unified School District decision to close all schools after receiving terrorist threat is met with approval from rest of nation, even though threats were found to be false; school districts in major cities receive similar threats and react differently as nation discusses best way to handle terrorist threats.

byline.original: By IAN LOVETT and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Los Angeles, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.

lead_paragraph: Even though the threat from the previous day had been deemed a hoax, many parents were wary of sending their children back to class.

headline.main: Los Angeles Schools Reopen With Many Parents on Edge
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Response to Threat Finds Support in Uneasy Times
